author: Laura Aubusson
title: ‘Your air conditioning is too noisy’: Gold Coast mother handed note from stranger
text:
MOST parents’ biggest concern when using a car on a hot day is not overheating the children. 
But one Gold Coast woman has bigger concerns, like the effect air conditioning has on a person’s complexion and the sensitive ears of others.
A Gold Coast mum was sitting in her car waiting to pick up her four-year-old from a school with the air conditioning cranked to keep her sleeping two-year-old cool.
While waiting she got a knock on her window. She pulled it down and a women aged in her 50s handed her a handwritten note.
“I thought ‘why is this woman knocking on my window? Is this note a fine or something?’” The mum told Kidspot .
The mother received the note will waiting at school pick-up. Source: News Corp. Source: Supplied 
Before the mum could ask anything, the woman walked off, and the mum opened the note which read:
“Just a short note to let you know that your air con is very noisy. I do not use mine because it is unhealthy, bad for your lungs & most of all your complexion. Do not feel obliged to turn it down, it is only my opinion about it.”
The mum was stunned.
It was a hot day, and she rightly thought there was more to worry about than the noise of her airconditioning.
“By the time I read the note she had walked off in the distance so I yelled out the window ‘I have a sleeping baby in the car, so it’s a no’,” she says.
The mum, who preferred to remain unnamed, has no plans to see the woman again, but just in case, she has her “sticky notes ready for the future school pick up”.
The mum who received the note is a friend of a Gold Coast blogger named Lauren, who shared the note to Facebook and was equally disgusted by the message.
“Should babies and toddlers (& children, adults and elderly) be forced to sit in sweltering conditions to avoid such a risk to their precious complexion? Ermmmm let’s weigh up the risks shall we…,” she wrote.
“On a day like today, when the outside temperature was mid-30s, temps can reach 50 degrees plus in just a matter of minutes in an UN-air-conditioned car. I think that’s more of concern, don’t you?”
Other Facebook users commented about their similar disbelief.
“Why is someone worried about a stranger’s complexion? It’s QLD anyway, I personally would have strapped an aircon to my head if I could have while living there. The world has some oddballs out there,” one wrote.
Another added, “Yes it would be so much better for your complexion to turn it off and see the internal temperature inside your car rise to 50-60 degrees in minutes! Whatever.”
Lauren said friends of the mum have since told her that she should have told the lady to take her opinion and shove it where the sun don’t shine.
This article originally appeared on Kidspot .
